English: Hey, Kay! /p!

Mio!
Have you been keeping well?
Yes.
He he.
You're together today as well.
Well, you know how it is.

Japanese:
お店の方はどうだ？
手伝い、がんばってる？
English:
How are things at the store?
Have you been doing your best to help out?
...Yeah.

Japanese:
でも、最近ちょっと
お客さん少なくて……。
English: But recently, there haven't been a lot of customers...

Japanese:
駅から離れすぎてる
からかな？
English: Maybe it's just too far from the station?

Japanese:
/pは
人形使いなんだよね？
English: /p is a Puppeteer, right?

Japanese:
お願い。
この店をもっと/c5駅のそば/c3まで
運んでくれないかな？
English:
I've got a favour to ask. 
Would it be too much trouble to transport this store /c5closer to the station/c3?
That's crazy!
So it can't be done?
It is possible.
But, it won't be pretty.

Japanese:
勝手にそんなことしたら、
親方に大目玉くらうぜ。
English: If we do that sort of thing without permission, we'll be scolded by our boss.
The siren!

Japanese:
オートマンだ！
/p！　行くぞ！
English:
It's an Automan!
/p! Let's go!
Hold on!

Japanese:
ドサクサにまぎれてなら
大丈夫じゃない？
English: Would it be all right if it's in the midst of the confusion?

Japanese:
お願い！
お店を/c5駅に近づけて！/c3
English:
Please!
Move the store /c5closer to the station!/c3

Japanese:
どうしても、
お店を守りたいの！
お願い！
English:
No matter what, I want to protect this store!
Please!
...All right.

It can't be helped.
/p, we're counting on you.

Japanese:
人助けだと思って、喫茶店を
駅のそばまで運んでやれ。
English: Consider it just another part of helping out, and carry the cafe near to the station.

Japanese:
ただし、迷惑になるような
場所には置くなよ。
駅の隣の区画に運ぶんだ。
English:
But, don't just dump it some place that it'll get in the way.
Move it to the area next to the station.

Japanese:
それと、
喫茶店が壊れないように
注意しろよ。
English: Also, make sure to pay attention so that the cafe doesn't get destroyed.
